title: transitionLeave={false} does not properly bypass the need to have a transition leave animation
body:
As the docs state, ReactCSSTransitionGroup keeps DOM elements on the page until an animation completes, thus necessitating a leave transition. If you want an enter animation but no leave animation, you can specify `transitionLeave={false}`. However, DOM elements still seem to stick around and occasionally throw the transitionend warning even when using `transitionLeave={false}`. (`transition(): tried to perform an animation without an animationend or transitionend event after timeout (5000ms). You should either disable this transition in JS or add a CSS animation/transition.`)

**Repro Case**
http://jsfiddle.net/kb3gN/2145/

**Steps to Reproduce**
- Click `Add All` to add three components to the page.
- Click `Remove All` to remove the added components.
  - Notice how some elements are staying on the page instead of removing all as expected
- Remove `transitionLeave={false}` from the JSX so the supplied leave transition runs
  - Removal works as expected (but with an undesired leave animation)

This occurs with both CSS transitions and with keyframe animations (change the `transitionName` from `transition-example` to `key-frame-example`).

**Workaround**
Remove `transitionLeave={false}` and use a 0sec leave transition.
_Disclaimer:_ this workaround doesn't seem bullet proof. At least in my more complex view that I'm creating, doing a handful (5-10) of additions/removals (and perhaps doing it fairly rapidly) will produce the transitionend warning, leaving elements in the UI.
